name: Eiji Aramaki
content: LUULULU | Eiji ARAMAKI, Ph.D. home | painting_works | music_works | cv_english | cv_japanese statement - AI's paintings feel a little lacking. Now that AI can create paintings and music, we are left wondering: âThen why do humans make art at all?â Holding that question close, she paints AI-generated images in oil, gently layering her own sensibilities onto them. Then something curious happensâ subtle tremors, hesitations, and other traces absent in AI begin to surface in the work. Working with AI every day in the field of information scienceâ understanding algorithms, reading experimental resultsâ we are still searching for something only humans can do. It is in observing those small differences that she believes we can find one answer to why we create art in this age.
